page.title: 11Landscape
page.content: Along the sea front are beach huts which are owmed or rented by mostly local people.The beach is mainly pebbles but sand is exposed at low tide.Many people dig for bait at low tide.Swans and sometimes ducks come onto the beach from the Haven. There are groynes at intervals down the beach.Fossil sharks teeth and palaeolithic implements can be found on the beach. Hill Head Sailing Club. This is aprivate sailing club situated to the east of the harbour.It has its own boat compound for members boats. There are various races held from late March until October ending with a prize giving at the end of the season. The clubhouse has a bar and the committee organise various social events throughout the year.There is also a sailboard section.
